content: समाधिः {@--1@} Collecting, composing, concentrating (as mind). {@--2@} Profound or abstract meditation, concentration of mind on one object, perfect absorption of thought into the one object of meditation, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} the Supreme Spirit, (the 8th and last stage of Yoga); आत्मेश्वराणां न हि जातु विघ्नाः समाधिभेदप्रभवो भवंति <ls>Ku. 3. 40</ls>, <ls n="Ku. 3.">50</ls>; <ls>Mk. 1. 1.</ls>; <ls>Bh. 3. 54</ls>; <ls>R. 8. 79</ls>; <ls>Śi. 4. 55.</ls> {@--3@} Intentness, concentration (in general), fixing of thoughts; तस्यां लग्नसमाधि (मानसं) <ls>Gīt. 3.</ls> {@--4@} Penance, religious obligation, devotion (to penance); अस्त्येत्समाधिभीरुत्वं देवानां <ls>Ś. 1</ls>; तपःसमाधि <ls>Ku. 3. 24</ls>; अथोपयंतारमलं समाधिना <ls n="Ku.">5. 24</ls>, <ls n="Ku.">5. 6</ls>; <ls n="Ku.">1. 59</ls>. {@--5@} Bringing together, concentration, combination, collection; तं वेधा विदधे नूनं महाभूतसमाधिना <ls>R. 1. 29.</ls> {@--6@} Reconciliation, settling or composing differences. {@--7@} Silence. {@--8@} Agreement, assent, promise. {@--9@} Requital. {@--10@} Completion, accomplishment. {@--11@} Perseverance in extreme difficulties. {@--12@} Attempting impossibilities. {@--13@} Laying up corn (in times of famine), storing grain. {@--14@} A tomb. {@--15@} The joint of the neck; a particular position of the neck; <ls>Ki. 16. 21.</ls> {@--16@} (In <ab>Rhet.</ab>) A figure of speech thus defined by Mammaṭa; समाधिः सुकरं कार्यं कारणांतरयोगतः <ls>K. P. 10</ls>; see <ls>S. D. 614.</ls> {@--17@} One of the ten Guṇas or merits of style; see <ls>Kāv. 1. 93.</ls> {@--18@} A religious vow or self-imposed restraint. {@--19@} Support, upholding.
